transcript:
evidently those in front had halted. All remained where they were in the middle of the muddy road. 
Fires were lighted and the talk became more audible. Captain Tushin, having given orders to his company, sent a soldier to find a dressing station or a doctor for the cadet, and sat down by a bonfire the soldiers had kindled on the road. Rost6v, too, dragged himself to the fire. From pain, cold, and damp, a feverish shiver- ing shook his whole body. Drowsiness was ir- resistibly mastering him,
